name: mcmicro-multiplex-imaging
title: Multiplexed Tissue Image Analysis
description: End-to-end processing of highly-multiplexed microscopy imaging data from CyCIF, CODEX, MIBI, and SeqIF platforms. Transforms multi-channel whole-slide images into single-cell data through registration, segmentation, and quantification. Samplesheet format: `sample,image_path`
content:
MCMICRO - Multiplexed Tissue Image Analysis

Comprehensive pipeline for processing highly-multiplexed microscopy imaging data from advanced spatial profiling technologies. Developed by Harvard Medical School's Laboratory of Systems Pharmacology, MCMICRO (Multiple Choice MICRO) offers flexible module selection for transforming multi-channel tissue images into analyzable single-cell data.

What is MCMICRO?

MCMICRO enables spatial biology by converting complex multiplexed microscopy images into quantitative single-cell measurements with spatial coordinates, revealing tissue architecture, cell-cell interactions, and microenvironment composition.

Key Features

  • Platform Agnostic: CyCIF, CODEX, MIBI, SeqIF support
  • Multiple Choice Modules: Flexible tool selection
  • Complete Workflow: Image to single-cell data
  • TMA Support: Tissue microarray processing
  • Multi-Cycle Imaging: Handle iterative staining
  • Spatial Analysis Ready: Coordinate-based outputs

Pipeline Workflow

  1. Image Registration: Align multi-cycle images with Ashlar
  2. Background Correction: Optional illumination and shading correction
  3. Segmentation: Multiple options (Cellpose, Mesmer, etc.)
  4. Quantification: MCQuant for marker intensity measurement
  5. Single-Cell Data: Generate spatial expression matrices

Scientific Applications

  • Spatial Biology: Study tissue microenvironment
  • Cancer Research: Tumor-immune interactions
  • Drug Discovery: Target expression and localization
  • Pathology: Digital tissue analysis
  • Systems Immunology: Immune cell positioning

Supported Technologies

  • CyCIF: Cyclic immunofluorescence
  • CODEX: CO-Detection by indEXing
  • MIBI: Multiplexed ion beam imaging
  • SeqIF: Sequential immunofluorescence
  • IMC: Imaging mass cytometry

Module Options

  • Segmentation: Cellpose, Mesmer, Ilastik, DeepCell
  • Registration: Ashlar for alignment
  • Quantification: MCQuant for feature extraction
  • Quality Control: Automated QC metrics

Advantages

  • Flexible: Choose best tools for your data
  • Comprehensive: Complete image-to-data workflow
  • Validated: Extensively tested on diverse datasets
  • Community Support: Active development and documentation
  • Reproducible: Containerized for consistency

Input Requirements

  • Image Files: Multi-channel TIFF or OME-TIFF
  • Samplesheet: Image cycles and file locations
  • Markersheet: Channel-to-marker mapping
  • Optional: Masks for tissue regions

Main Outputs

  • Registered Images: Aligned multi-cycle data
  • Cell Masks: Segmentation results
  • Single-Cell Data: Quantified marker expression per cell
  • Spatial Coordinates: Cell position information
  • QC Reports: Image and segmentation quality
  • Visualization: Overlay images and masks

Perfect for: Multiplexed Imaging • Spatial Biology • Tissue Analysis • Cancer Research • Immunology
